IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: The Arc of Greensboro is committed to identifying and securing life-long opportunities for children & adults with intellectual & developmental disabilities. Through advocacy, services, programs, and education,The Arc supports individuals & their families in choosing options that lead to productive & satisfying lives.
IRS990.MissionDesc: The Arc of Greensboro is committed to identifying and securing life-long opportunities for children & adults with intellectual & developmental disabilities. Through advocacy, services, programs, and education,The Arc supports individuals & their families in choosing options that lead to productive & satisfying lives.
IRS990.Desc: Supported Employment - Provide training and job coaching to over 200 persons with intellectual and developmental disabilities

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Education and Community Support Services - Educate and provide case management services to more than 80 children and adults with intellectual and developmental disabilities

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: ArcBARKS dog treats was conceived and developed by The Arc of Greensboro to provide vocational training for individuals with intellectual and developmental disabilities and a way for The Arc of Greensboro to give back to the Greensboro community.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part V, Line 4: Intended uses of the endowment fund.
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The endowment funds are used primarily to provide assistance and support for those with intellectual disabilities.

The Organization is exempt from income tax under Section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code except on net income derived from unrelated business activities. For the year ended June 30, 2018, the Organization has determined that no income taxes are due for its activities. Accordingly, no provision for income taxes has been recorded in the financial statements.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule L, Part V Supplemental Information
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Lyndsay Champion is the daughter of Executive Director Linda Yurko and is employed by The Arc of Greensboro.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 6: Explanation of Classes of Members or Shareholder
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: There is one class of membership. Membership is by application and contingent on the payment of dues.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 7a: How Members or Shareholders Elect Governing Body
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: At the annual meeting members vote to approve candidates for the Board of Directors after presentation of the slate of appointees by the Nominating committee and preliminary approval by the Board of Directors.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 7b: Describe Decisions of Governing Body Approval by Members or Shareholders
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Organization members have the right to approve or rescind any board of director action through a vote at any organization regular or specially called meeting.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b: Form 990 Review Process
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The President received the prepared Form 990 by mail. The Board President submits it.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Board, staff and volunteers are covered under the conflict of interest policy. They sign the document annually and it is kept in the company files.Full disclosure, by notice in writing, shall be made to the Board of Directors in all conflicts of interest. Following full disclosure of a potential conflict of interest, the Board of Directors shall determine whether a conflict actually exists and, if so, shall vote to authorize or reject the transaction and/or condition.A)An interested director, officer or employee shall not participate in any discussion or debate of the Board of Directors or of any committee thereof, in which the subject of discussion is a contract, transaction, or situation in which there may be a conflict of interest.B)No director, officer, or employee shall participate in the selection, award, or administration of a procurement transaction in which public funds are used, where, to his knowledge, any of the following has a financial interest in that transaction: (1) the employee, officer or director; (2) any member of his immediate family; (3) his partner; (4) an organization in which any of the above is an officer, director, shareholder, partner, equity holder or employee; or (5) a person or organization with whom any of the above is negotiating or has any arrangement concerning prospective employment.A copy of this policy shall be given to all directors, officers & employees upon commencement of such persons relationship with the Arc. Each board member, officer & employee shall sign/date the policy at the beginning of his term of service or employment or if the person is already in position, immediately upon the Arc implementing this policy. Failure to sign does not nullify the policy.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15a: Compensation Review & Approval Process - CEO, Top Management
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Executive Board reviews the compensation of the Executive Director, using data of comparable compensation for those with similar qualifications in similar functional positions. The last review of compensation for the Executive Director was held in 2014. No change in comp since 2014.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15b: Compensation Review and Approval Process for Officers and Key Employees
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Identify the offices or position for which the process was used to establish compensations of the persons who served in those offices or positions, and enter the year in which this process was last undertaken for each such person.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The organization makes its governing documents, conflict of interest policy and financial statements available to the public on the organization's website and are available upon request.
